content.description: A fun slab route with a technical crux after the high first bolt.
content.location: The obvious bolted line on the face left of the dihedral at the west end of the wall.

content.description: Variation. Start in the corner at the base of the crack. Traverse left into the second bolt on the Spice is Life. Decent climbing but short lived.
content.location: Starts in the corner at the base of an obvious dihedral crack. Moves onto left face.

content.description: Climbs the slightly overhung dihedral before a delicate transition into slabby ground. Stickclip the first bolt. Start on the rock stack with hard underclings and tough feet. A brief v5 boulder leads to cool pulls and a good rest, clip the second bolt and do some trickery to get established on the slab above. Currently the route then runs it out on low angle terrain to the last couple bolts on TSIL. An independent finish is in the near future.
content.location: The furthest west route on the wall. The starting stack should be obvious.

content.description: Burn one down, trim your nails, and open the third eye. Establish on the wall with a few good holds to the start of the business. A techy crux resides above the first bolt then inch your way up a sea of edges measured in millimeters. The second crux is moving over the bulge at the top and seems to be in the v4/5 range. Excellent and cryptic slab climbing.
content.location: Currently the first obvious line of bolts as you enter the crag.

content.description: Short but sweet. This fun corner crack has got liebacks, jamming, stemming, etc. Currently the corner tops out with a mildly spooky mantle. Bolted anchors should be installed in the near future.
content.location: Obvious corner on the west side of the wass.

content.description: Mostly slabby or vertical limestone. Sunny year round.
